brief.brief: Scripting allows for a set of formats to be displayed in a pre-defined sequence.
It can be of significant benefit during any process that requires a set of information to be supplied by the operator and during the Problem determination process.

detail.detail: Based on operator-entered data, the Script makes decisions as to which form to display next. The operator-entered data accumulates until the Script process is complete and is then passed back to the calling application.
During execution, Scripting has the look and feel of a customized Service Manager application, and can be used in place of most Service Manager routines designed to gather data from a user.

Each Script displays a standard Service Manager form and runs its own Format Control record. If a Format Control definition fails, as could happen if there is an error, Service Manager returns the user to the last displayed Script Format.
